conclusion: Use properties of light reflection and refractive index to solve the problem.
Refractive index is given as sqrt(3) and angle of incidence is 120 degrees.
Distance between people in the tank is given as 18 cm.
Angle of reflection is 60 degrees because angles of incidence and reflection are complementary.
Ratio of refracted light to incident light is sqrt(3), so distance from surface to point where light hits material is 18 * sqrt(3) cm.
Light travels from exterior to interior, distance from surface to point where light hits material is sum of thickness of tank wall and distance between people.
Total distance is 18 cm (thickness of tank wall) + 18 cm (distance between people) = 36 cm.
Distance between people is equal to distance from surface to point where light hits material, which is 18 * sqrt(3) cm.
Distance between people is 36 cm - 18 * sqrt(3) cm.
Calculate final distance: 36 - 18 * sqrt(3) cm simplifies to 36 - 18 * 1.732 cm = 36 - 30.192 cm.
Final distance between people is approximately 5.808 cm.
The distance between them is approximately 5.808 cm.
